main event: On September 6, 1957, at 2300 hours in N. Truro, Massachusetts, an observer on the ground reported a 3-second sighting of an unidentified aerial object that followed a flame, angled down, and disappeared, resembling a meteor flame going out.
interesting points: The observer reported the object abruptly changing color from glow to red and taking off fast on a 242-degree heading.
The report includes a questionnaire with details about the observation, such as wind conditions, cloud cover, and compass disturbances.
The object was described as hovering in one spot, changing color, and then taking off on a fast heading.
The witness was unable to construct a model that accurately represented what was seen, indicating the unusual nature of the sighting.
The observer indicated uncertainty about the size and distance of the object, highlighting the challenge of estimating these aspects.
